=ðŸŽ£ PHISHING CAMPAIGN ALERT

THREAT SEVERITY: HIGH
DETECTION RATE: 73.9% of BEC attacks are credential-focused

ACTIVE CAMPAIGNS:

1. Google Cloud Integration Abuse
   Vector: Spoofed Google notifications (9,000+ emails sent)
   Target: Manufacturing, Finance, Technology sectors
   Method: Multi-step redirect to Microsoft credential harvesting sites
   
2. ConsentFix Attack (NEW)
   Vector: OAuth consent + ClickFix-style prompts
   Target: Enterprise users with cloud access
   Method: Browser-native attack bypassing traditional defenses
   
3. npm Package Phishing
   Vector: Malicious packages on npm registry
   Target: DevOps teams, developers
   Method: Credential harvesting via package names
   
4. Webrat Campaign
   Vector: Fake GitHub repositories with CVE PoCs
   Target: Security researchers, gamers
   Method: Droppers disable Defender, deploy backdoor

STATISTICS:
â€¢ 54% of phishing breaches result in credential theft
â€¢ 27% lead to cloud account compromise
â€¢ 15% use MFA phishing kits (AiTM attacks)
â€¢ Average cost: $4.88M per breach

RECOMMENDED ACTIONS:
1. BLOCK Google Cloud redirect patterns
2. DEPLOY email filters for OAuth consent lures
3. AUDIT npm package installations
4. WARN teams about fake GitHub PoC repos
5. ENABLE MFA phishing-resistant methods (FIDO2)

parameters.subject: ðŸŽ£ Phishing Alert: Active Credential Theft Campaigns
parameters.text:
=PHISHING THREAT INTELLIGENCE REPORT

THREAT SEVERITY: HIGH

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY:
Multiple sophisticated phishing campaigns are targeting enterprise users with credential theft as the primary objective. Organizations must strengthen email security and user awareness.

DETAILED CAMPAIGNS:

1. GOOGLE CLOUD APPLICATION INTEGRATION ABUSE
â€¢ Volume: 9,000+ spoofed emails sent
â€¢ Sectors: Manufacturing, Finance, Technology
â€¢ Technique: Multi-step redirect through Google domains
â€¢ Destination: Microsoft-themed credential harvesting site

2. CONSENTFIX ATTACK (NEW TECHNIQUE)
â€¢ Type: Browser-native OAuth consent phishing
â€¢ Method: ClickFix-style user prompts
â€¢ Impact: Bypasses traditional email filters

3. MALICIOUS npm PACKAGES
â€¢ Vector: 27+ packages on npm registry
â€¢ Target: DevOps teams, developers
â€¢ Impact: Direct credential harvesting

4. WEBRAT CAMPAIGN
â€¢ Lure: Fake GitHub repos with CVE PoC code
â€¢ Targets: Security researchers, gamers, students
â€¢ Impact: Backdoor deployment, keylogging

STATISTICS:
â€¢ 73.9% of BEC attacks = credential phishing
â€¢ 54% of phishing breaches = successful credential theft
â€¢ 27% of incidents = cloud account compromise
â€¢ 15% = MFA bypass via AiTM phishing kits
â€¢ Average breach cost: $4.88M

DEFENSE RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. Deploy advanced email filtering with URL sandboxing
2. Implement DMARC, SPF, DKIM enforcement
3. Enable FIDO2/WebAuthn MFA (resistant to phishing)
4. Monitor for suspicious OAuth consent requests
5. Block npm package installations from untrusted sources
6. Train users to recognize consent phishing patterns
7. Use browser extensions to detect ConsentFix patterns
